author: _shemnon
content: EEST execute isn't going as smoothly as I hoped.  So I'm going to switch tracks, I'll write assertors for things I know have forked the fuzzer.  My working kurtosis already forks out nethermind because of legacy initcode creating EOF in contract creation processes, for example: https://gist.github.com/shemnon/3854a75448dff222b04a09909ad1394c/ - This jibes with Assertor's purpose to quickly shake out known bugs.

author: parithosh
content:
If these are longer term tests, could you add it here under a folder called eof-dev? https://github.com/ethpandaops/assertoor/tree/master/playbooks

we can then also have an `all.yaml` under eof and calling that will call all the underlying tests

author: _shemnon
content: After osaka-devnet-1 I'll start doing that.  We still have some incompatible changes in the pipeline over the next month.

author: _shemnon
content: (specifically, the EOF containers/opcodes may be different for devnet-1, but then we will start locking down non-security related breaking changes to most areas at that point)

author: _shemnon
content: Do we want to spin another release of the EIP7692 EEST tests or is the 2.1.0 release from november sufficient?
